info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 10 at 3:08PM EDT until May 10 at 4:15PM EDT by NWS Burlington VT
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues.
* WHERE...A portion of northwest Vermont, including the following county, Chittenden.
* WHEN...Until 415 PM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 307 PM EDT, At 1149 AM, local law enforcement reported flooding on Pettingill Rd near Browns River Rd. Flooding is already occurring. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... SLOPE: 13 - Alder Brook headwaters., SLOPE: 11 - Browns River along Route 128 to Pettingill Rd., SLOPE: 16 - Abbey Brook, along Osgood Hill Rd., SLOPE: 22 - Inflow to Browns River, crosses Weed Rd between Jericho/Essex Ctr., SLOPE: 11 - Browns River along Rte 128 from Pettingill Rd to Westford., SLOPE: 15 - Rogers Brook through Brookside in Westford, along Brookside Rd., SLOPE: 8 - Morgan Brook, flows into Browns River at Westford. and SLOPE: 10 - Browns River, crosses Rte 15 between Essex Center and Jericho. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Westford and Essex. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON
